SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

edu.vt.cbil.visda.comp
Class CFMCore

java.lang.Object
  edu.vt.cbil.visda.comp.CFMCore

public class CFMCore
extends java.lang.Object

The class performs clustering model formulation (parameter estimation using EM) tasks

Version:
visda_v0.4 Version Log: visda_v0.1 (07/30/2005): The file is created and basic function is implemented. visda_v0.2 (08/30/2005): visda_v0.3 (09/30/2005): visda_v0.4 (10/29/2005): Implement MDL calculation;
Author:
Jiajing Wang

Field Summary
(package private)  double[][] Cov_mat
          the Covariance matrixes for all clusters in t-space; they are concatenated on columns, i.e., if there are k clusters, this will be a 2-dimension array with [p][p*k]
(package private)  double[][] Data
          the data matrix
(package private)  double errorThresh
          the error threshold to stop the loop of EM algorithm
 boolean isValid
          indicate whether the EM results are valid (all values are real)
(package private)  double mdl
          the MDL value
(package private)  double[][] Mean0_x
          the initial Means of clusters; each row is for one cluster
(package private)  double[][] Mean1_x
          the Means of clusters in t-space;; each row is for one cluster
(package private)  int numClusters
          the number of clusters at the current level
(package private)  int numFeatures
          the number of features
(package private)  int numSamples
          the number of samples
(package private)  double vv
          the value for initializing the Covariance matrix of clusters
(package private)  double[] W0
          the initial mixing proportions of all clusters
(package private)  double[] W0_t
          the mixing proportions of the identified clusters in t-space
(package private)  double[][] Zjk
          the posterior probabilities of all samples belonging to all clusters at the current level; each column is for one cluster
(package private)  double[] Zjk_up
          the posterior probabilities of samples belonging to the cluster at the upper level

          This Native (C++) function performs the EM algorithm
 void veSubNew()
          The method calls the EM native function and collects the results

Constructor Detail

CFMCore

public CFMCore(int n,
               int p,
               int k)
Create a CFMCore instance

Parameters:
n - the number of samples
p - the number of genes
k - the number of clusters at the current level
Method Detail

veModel

public int veModel(int n,
                   int p,
                   int k,
                   double[] D,
                   double[] mean0_x,
                   double[] Var0,
                   double[] w0,
                   double[] Gxn,
                   double[] Fx)
This Native (C++) function calculates the mixed Gaussian Model

Parameters:
n - the number of rows of matrix data
p - the number of columns of matrix data
k - the number of clusters
D - the matrix data is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
mean0_x - the Means of clusters; each row is for one cluster; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
Var0 - a group of matrixes containing the Covariance matrix of all clusters; the covariance matrixes are concatenated on columns
w0 - the mixing proportions of all clusters
Gxn - the probability per sample per cluster
Fx - the probability per sample
Returns:
'1'- successfully exit; '0'- exit with waring/error

veSubEM

public int veSubEM(int n,
                   int p,
                   int k,
                   double[] D,
                   double[] mean0_x,
                   double[] w0,
                   double vv,
                   double error,
                   double[] Zjk_up,
                   double[] mean1_x,
                   double[] w0_t,
                   double[] cov_mat,
                   double[] Zjk,
                   double[] mdl)
This Native (C++) function performs the EM algorithm

Parameters:
n - the number of rows of matrix data
p - the number of columns of matrix data
k - the number of clusters
D - the matrix data is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
mean0_x - the initial Means of clusters; each row is for one cluster; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
w0 - the initial mixing proportions of all clusters
vv - the value for initializing the Covariance matrix of clusters
error - the error threshold
Zjk_up - the posterior probabilities of samples belonging to the cluster at the upper level
mean1_x - the Means of clusters in t-space; each row is for one cluster; it is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
w0_t - the mixing proportions of the identified clusters in t-space
cov_mat - the Covariance matrixes of all clusters in t-space; they are concatenated on columns; the concatenated matrix is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
Zjk - the posterior probabilities of all samples belonging to all clusters at the current level; each column is for one cluster
Returns:
'1'- successfully exit; '0'- exit with waring/error

veSubNew

public void veSubNew()
The method calls the EM native function and collects the results

print

public void print()
This method prints the result of the EM algorithm
